trees.name: Oak Tree
trees.description: Oak trees absorb carbon dioxide, improve air quality, and provide habitats for various wildlife.
care: Watering: Deep watering during dry spells, especially in the first few years.
Mulching: Apply mulch to retain moisture.
Pruning: Prune in late winter to shape and remove dead branches.

trees.name: Maple Tree
trees.description: Known for its beautiful fall colors, the maple tree supports wildlife and can be tapped for syrup.

trees.name: Pine Tree
trees.description: Pine trees provide year-round greenery, support wildlife, and stabilize soil.
care: Mulching: Use mulch to retain moisture.

trees.name: Cedar Tree
trees.description: Cedar trees are resistant to decay, providing habitats for wildlife and improving air quality.
care: Location: Full sun to partial shade.
Mulching: Mulch to retain soil moisture.
Pruning: Minimal pruning needed; shape as necessary.

trees.name: Apple Tree
trees.description: Apple trees produce delicious fruit, support biodiversity, and can be part of sustainable gardening.
care: Watering: Regular watering, especially when young.
Pruning: Prune annually to promote healthy growth.

trees.name: Cherry Tree
trees.description: Cherry trees yield sweet or tart fruit, attract pollinators, and enhance landscape beauty.

trees.name: Sycamore Tree
trees.description: Provides large shade areas, improving urban environments and supporting wildlife.
care: Watering: Regular watering, especially in dry periods.

trees.name: Linden Tree
trees.description: Offers dense foliage for shade and fragrant flowers that attract bees.
care: Location: Full sun to partial shade.
Pruning: Prune to maintain shape and health.

trees.name: Willow Tree
trees.description: Willows help manage water runoff, improve water quality, and provide habitats.
care: Location: Prefers wet or damp areas.
Pruning: Prune in late winter to control growth.

trees.name: Alder Tree
trees.description: Alders improve soil quality and provide habitats; they can fix nitrogen.
care: Location: Full sun to partial shade.
Mulching: Use mulch to retain moisture.
Pruning: Prune to shape and remove dead branches.

trees.name: Red Maple
trees.description: Adapted to local conditions, red maples provide habitats and improve air quality.
care: Location: Full sun to partial shade.
Mulching: Use mulch to retain moisture.

trees.name: Black Cherry
trees.description: Provides fruit for wildlife and is valuable for timber; supports local ecosystems.
care: Mulching: Apply mulch to retain moisture.
Pruning: Prune to remove dead or crossing branches.
